On the other hand, "P and Q" means that both P and Q must be true. 

In this case, the original statement "The wump might blurble grazzle or it might flibbit snork" allows for the possibility that the wump does either one or the other, or potentially both. 

The second statement "The wump might blurble grazzle and it might flibbit snork" asserts that the wump has the potential to do both.
